reviews.review: Astounding massage. I was just in for a 90 minute massage with Santosh. I myself am a massage therapist from Canada, so I can be tricky to please. He offered very deep pressure and accurate palpation to find all of my trigger points. All of the therapists at seeing hands receive extensive training in massage therapy (and even some chiropractic training) from the UK. I was surprised to receive an adjustment at the end, but felt safe and adjusted easily after the massage. I wouldn't go anywhere else and will return many times while I visit Nepal. They offered dim lighting, a comfortable massage table and music. The price is great for the quality. It's always nice to leave a little tip if you feel they are deserving for their great work.

Sports massage. My husband and I came to Seeing Hands after doing a 2 week trek. My massage therapist was Santos & he was great at being attentive, focusing on the areas of need, & very professional. The staff were all very friendly and efficient. I will come back here when I come back to Kathmandu. My husband really loved his massage as well, he had a guy as well, I think his name was Ganga.

WOW !. One of the best massage I had in my Life ... what a wonderful expérience.I found this place from trip adviser.This tiny young woman greets me and when she started I couldn't beleive the streinght she had in her hands.I could feel her lifes strenght and challenge from her hands.I started to cry, I was overwhelm by this unique expérience.This place is fantastic.Her name is Bhima

Thank you Bhima. Thank you to Bhima and her talented little hands... My shoulders are very sour now but Im gonna sleep Well tonight and I am looking forward to come back for a 90min swedish massage to relax the tension a bit more.

Wonderful massage!!!. I spent the last day in my two-month trip to Nepal doing massage at Seeing Hands Nepal. After refering to another very expensive massage spa then walking around to find the right location in a quiet corner of bustling Thamel without booking in advance, I was welcomed by the warm hospitality of all staff in Seeing Hands.Same to many of you guy who tried several kinds of massage in different countries, I was surprised at how professional the staffs in the clinic are. My masseuse (Her name is Bhima, I suppose) knew exactly where I got hurt and gave me useful advices. It was amazing when my serious headache reduced much right after the massage. My flight back to homeland was better thanks to her skillful hands. Thank you for such a good experience! It's always worth a try to give support to real social enterprise like Seeing Hands Nepal.

Amazing experience!. The therapist were amazing! It was the first time that I had sport massage but my sister who had several times in London said that this was by far the best! Don't hesitate by the look of the reception. Kindly ask the therapist to walk you at the massage rooms, there you will see that it's clean and comfy.There is a music as a background (I read reviews that said there wasn't) but sometimes you get some noise out of the window.. busy Thamel though! You must visit!!!!
Wonderful. Cannot more highly recommend this clinic. My female massage therapist was most accomodating and professional. Lovely and simple facilities. Delightful.

BEST MASSAGE EVER (I get a massage once a month) . I am from Canada. I've had massages all over North America and a few in Nepal. This is by far the best massage I have ever had. I tipped my masseuse the price of the massage itself. She found all my trouble spots IMMEDIATELY and got rid of all of them. I had the very popular woman masseuse I think her name was Litska or something like that. It is written in some other reviews here! Either way, the bunch of them are so lovely and amazing. I had a hoot talk to them before my massage. They are very smart! You MUST try this place if you are looking for a massage.

An amazing experience!. I am exposed to different massages from different parts of the world and yet, this one left me with a stunning surprise and humble experience. The seeing hands clinic is run by a number of visually challenged fantastic human beings. They are outstanding in feeling your knots and working on them individually until they are sorted. The enthusiasm and positive energy these people bring in you are priceless. This is million dollar experience for anyone. This is an experience of a lifetime and i strongly recommend you don't miss it while in Kathmandu.
Wooooooow!. These people are amazing! Massage was above all expectations and they were very kind. They can really "see" with their hands! My recommendation to anyone who comes to Kathmandu
Amazing. What an amazing business. Laxmi was my masseuse and I would highly recommend her. Two hour massage for $3400npr.
Amazing. A must do, great sports massage needed after a month of intense yoga and pre trek. Highly recommend. Great cause too!

Best Massage in Town. Even if you don't do massages, go here and get one !In KTM you do need one and this is the best place !Very affordable prices and the people there are great.Very friendly and they all studied massaging. Very professional.The place is a two story house and very clean.If you don;t have an appointment, you're probably lucky to get a free slot.One day they even accepted me after it was officially closed !

Excellent experience. Coming back to Kathmandu from the difficult trek , having some problem with my knee we booked 90 minutes massage. Wow. one of the best my experience in Nepal! Staff is very professional and friendly. Room is very clean. I can say their hands brought us back to life!!!!

Fantastic!!. My husband and I made an appointment, but showed up 2 hours before and could be massaged right away. The two boys massaging us were great; perfect pressure, perfect level of chatting, everything nice! Can really recommend this to anyone. It's nice and clean. The price is really good and the people are extremely nice. Must do!

BEST 27 dollars I spent during this trip!!. I was not in the mood for a massage but my girlfriend insisted to go here so we went , it's been the best massage I've had in my life , Santos the guy who was giving me a massage asked if I have any particular pain in my body, so I told him about the issue I had in my left hip that goes down my left leg, so he asked me questions while massaging my hip and legs and doing some tricks , so he diagnosed me for having a SCIATICA , so when I went to see my physiotherapist He said Thats exactly what I have .Now I'm on therapy and I don't have any more pain thanks to him . I never write reviews but these guys really know what they are doing and they are great at it . Pay them a visit. You won't regret it :)

Magic Hands!! Best Massage!! Excellent!!!!!!. Hands down the best massage I have had anywhere in the world!!!!! My massage therapist name was Vhima. Her hands were like magic!She found all my problem spots within the first 30 seconds without me even telling her.I've had back and shoulder problems most of my life and she done the most amazing job of making me feel normal again. She was always asking if I needed more or less pressure. I took the sports deep tissue massage for 90 minutes and it was the best money I've spent on my health. The clinic doesn't look much from the outside but it's very clean and the money goes to a great cause. The massage therapist are professionally trained and you won't regret your decision going here. Enjoy :)

An excellent massage and a very different experience!. I had a wonderful 90 minute massage here in June of 2016. The masseuses were professional and kind, and I was very happy with my experience. It was definitely a different massage experience than I was used to, however- the lights are on, there is no music except the sound of the fan, you can hear the traffic and noise from the city around you, and the masseuses may make conversation with you throughout the massage. Don't let that discourage you though, it is well worth your time! I certainly look forward to going again in the future.

amazing massage- would have gone back if it wasn't my last day in town. My boyfriend and I did the 60 minute sports therapy massage. The facilities were super clean and comfortable, and that's saying a lot for Kathmandu. The restroom in reception had toilet paper! This is like spotting an endangered species in Nepal. We were in a room together for our massage. Our two masseuses (sp?) were friendly and super nice. Excellent conversational English. They laughed at my boyfriend's corny jokes. They seemed overall very dedicated and happy to do this work. Ganga was my masseuse. He worked out only about a zillion knots in my back and shoulders in a really short time. It was painful but amazingly rejuvenating. I was making all sorts of wimpy noises throughout, which we were all laughing about. I liked that the atmosphere was relaxed & not stuffy, like some USA spa/massage places can be. Afterwards, when we were paying at reception, some of the other masseuses (sp?) were in the room and all super friendly, asking if we enjoyed ourselves and where we were from. It happened to be our last day in town but had we visited earlier in our trip, I would have no doubt gone back. Ask for Ganga, he murdered my body (in a good way).

Really the best massage I've ever had by Laxmi. I don't usually leave reviews on tripadvisor although I've travelled to many countries. However, I really wanted to leave a quick note about this place. It's a small 2-story establishment in Thamel (be patient, you will find it, it's located at the end of the street and has a big sign) that is run and serviced by the blind. A colleague and I got one massage each and we both agreed that they were the best massages we both have ever experienced. First, we were running a little late due to the really bad traffic in Kathmandu and we also got a little lost on the way. I called and the person who answered the phone (who also did the massage on my colleague) gave instructions to our driver (while being blind!) and him and his wife waited for us to get there. Jaxmi worked on me, and I was a bit hesitant, because I've had lower back and hip issues, however she could tell exactly where all of my issues were without me saying a word. Their sense of touch is absolutely incredible. She said I could probably get rid of most of my issues if I had 2 or 3 more sessions and I think there might be some truth to that because my body felt incredible revived afterwards (and also tired). I will be sure to go back to them the next time I go to Nepal, becuase of the high quality of work that they do. I highly recommend it and hope folks like me will support this establishment because they really do an amazing job, sight or no sight.
Great massage by extremely friendly masseuse!. Very friendly staff and excellent massages! Came here with the wife for an hour and left feeling relaxed and revitalized. Highly recommended!

Go visit Seeing Hands!. I had a one hour massage from Laxmi and came away feeling rejuvenated and relaxed. There is a perceptible different in the massages from Seeing Hands and something truly special about the service they offer. The rooms were tidy and clean, there was no distracting "calming" music allowing focus on the massage itself. I would highly recommend this experience as a way of relaxing in Kathmandu and giving back to the community.
Good massage. Great massage made by blind people. Professional services, clean room and good value for money. A good relax!!!!

Can't get enough!. Great massage! I went twice this week, it is just so good! I got the deep tissue massage from Ramji, and he could feel exactly where my muscles were tense, and he knew how to get the tension out. Definitely recommend this place.

Wonderful massage! . My husband and I enjoyed wonderful massages here after a lot of trekking! Ganga gave my husband a foot massage and Bhima worked her magic with a full body sports massage for me! she was able to work out so many knots....really worth a visit.
Excellent massage. Very good 60min massage in Patan branch. Deep and professional work and environment. Highly recommended for a trip in Kathmandu.

Great massage. After trying the clinic they have in pokhara and being very impressed I decided to go here on my last day in Kathmandu too. While I had the sports massage in pokhara, I went for the Swedish one here and while considerably less painful it was very relaxing. On top of that, it's a great cause too so I can't recommend either of these clinics enough.

Awesome massage once again!. I have had heaps of stress the past week and was so in need of a relaxing massage to unwind my tension so I as I am back in Nepal visiting I made my way to Seeing Hands clinic hoping they had a free slot - they did! Laxmi ironed out all my knots and I left feeling like a new person. The clinic seems like it has gone through a renovation, cleaner and more lively than I last remembered - it has always been friendly but this time it seemed even more relaxed, friendly and welcoming. I am going to make sure I get another massage before I leave Kathmandu ... maybe just before that long plane ride!

Relaxing, enjoyable.. just wow. Seeing Hands Clinic is a place where blind people do massages. Because they are blind they are much more sensitive which makes the massage a lot more intense. Furthermore I find the project good and worth supporting as the possibilities for blind people to find a job in Nepal are not many. You can choose between 3 different massage: Sport Therapy Remedial, Sweedish Relaxing Massage and Foot Massage.Furthermore you can choose between 1h or 1.5h. The cost are respectively $16 and $24.I went for the Sport Therapy Remedial which really cured all of my myalgia and loosened me up quite a lot. I can highly recommend Seeing Hands Clinic. So if you're in Kathmandu, make sure you have time to stop by this clinic, you won't regret it!

Best massage I've ever had. Last night I could not sleep due to a terrible back ache and in the morning I was hardly able to get up. At 7.30 am I thus googled “massage Patan” and thanks to the positive reviews I found on trip advisor, I immediately called “Seeing Hands” for an appointment. At 8.30 I had already an appointment with Mr. Ramji. One hour later, thanks to the best massage I've ever had, the pain was miraculously almost completely gone! I am profoundly grateful to Ramje and from now onwards I will certainly have a massage at “Seeing Hands” at least once a week! I strongly recommend “Seeing Hands” to anybody, both to prevent as well as to cure severe back problems! It also needs to be mentioned that “Seeing Hands” is not just a business, but a social enterprise offering valuable training and employment opportunities to blind women and men!Jennifer

From one masseuse to another. I have just had a 60 min massage from laxmi. She was fabulous. I am also a masseuse and therefore highly critical but her massage was top standard.The only criticism I would have is the temperature. I was cold although it didn't spoil my treatment. Also the head cushion could do with being a little more comfortable as I felt I had my head on wood. She spent the whole hour on my back which was fine and it probably needed it. Although I would have kept some of my clothes on had I realised my legs weren't going to be posted. This is positive criticism and something with the right communication can easily be rectified. Thanks again laxmi.

Amazing. Ive just had the most amazing deep tissue massage at seeing hands clinic Thamel KTM. After a month of manual labour volunteering in melamchi by body was in desperate need of a massage. I wasnt dissappointed my masseuse was called beema and really knew where to target n dont be put off by her size. She maybe small but she's strong n could adjust the pressure if i wanted it. The only thing i would say that if your looking for a relaxing massage then maybe consider one of the other clinics as you do get the street noise n dogs barking , but then your in the middle of KTM so its to be expected. It didnt bother me tho n didnt affect my experience at all. Il definetely be visiting again before i return home.

Santosh is fantastic!. I am a yoga teacher here in Nepal and there is no other place I would go for a massage! I have consistently seen Santosh for a hamstring issue I have and he has worked wonders for me! All of the therapists at Seeing Hands have been trained by physical therapists from the UK and know their stuff! Santosh can always tell me the Latin name of the muscle or band he is working on, and his English is fantastic! I highly recommend a massage from Seeing Hand especially after a trek! Their business has been greatly affected by the drop in tourism since the earthquakes, so please support them by going and getting a massage!
Very good massage. My massage was very good My only complaint was how cold the room was more blankets or I would be willing to pay more to have heat on( I know there is a fuel shortage right now)

Strong and tender. I have had 4 massages in 2 weeks at Seeing Hands. I was impressed with the professional standard of the massage and the cheerfulness of the staff. After trekking for 3 weeks I went for a 1hr sport therapy massage with Ganga. He asked important questions about what I wanted and ensured a good level pressure for my aching muscles. I left feeling light as a cloud. I went back the next day for the relaxing Swedish massage and could feel the difference in my body.I took several friends and had similar experiences. They have both male and female masseuse and took "great care" to meet our needs.Highly recommend this venture! Prices are around 20usd.
One of the best massage ever!. One of the best massages ever in Nepal. Do get it if you are in Kathmandu! I got Deep tissue massage and it was worth the money.
Sensational. These guys are the experts. Well priced, polite, and very skilled. I got a foot massage which included a deep tissue calf massage. Well worth (1800?) Rs.

Awesome massage in Lalitpur. My wife and I and a friend visited Seeing Hands in Lalitpur last week. Met these awesome people Ramji and Swastika who massaged us well. I had a back problem plus a chronic knee injury. Ramji seemed to have found the root cause of my backache because until now, the pain has gone away! On the other hand , my knee pain has only improved slight. I believe with a couple more visits, Ramji will be able to solve this problem. Well done Mr Ramji!

Do try it. I had Chiran who has been working with Seeing hands since 2005. Very friendly, great english and highly skilled. He was very good and kept checking to see if the pressure was comfortable for me, he was great at focusing on all the pressure points and working on some knots i had in my shoulder from my work. Went with friends and we would all definitely recommend.

Amazing Deep Tissue. After traveling for 2+ weeks, my back was killing me. Try as I might I could not find a chiropractor in Kathmandu. Fortunately, I packed pain killers and muscle relaxers, but they were only temporary fixes. With a day of sightseeing ahead of me, I thought I should start with a massage. Looking on Trip Advisor, Seeing Hands was the most highly recommended. However, that was not the determining factor. The fact that the massage therapists were blind led me to believe that that their other four senses, especially touch, would be particularly heightened, which would only enhance the massage experience. I was not wrong. Seeing Hands has three locations; one, in Patan, was a five minute walk from the Himalaya Hotel where I was staying (Exit the hotel, cross the street and turn left. Go two blocks and turn right. Walk about 300 feet. The Norwegian Embassy is on the right, Seeing Hands is just up ahead on the left.) It also happened to be the newest location and the least expensive of the three. The facilities were immaculate, cleaner than my hotel. I was met at the gate by Ramji, my massage therapist. His English was excellent (plus he was really easy on the eyes :-)). He asked me if I had any surgery , medical issues or pain that he should be aware of. I told him of my back problems, so he spent a lot of time on my back. He sense of touch was intuitive. He completely hit on the 3 pain points on my back, especially the two really sore ones. When I left, I was virtually pain free. Even now, eight hours after my massage, my back does not hurt. Back in the U.S. a 90 minute massage is way out of my price range. Here I can not only afford one, I can afford one every other day. I already made an appoint for Tuesday. I would unequivocally recommend this place for a solid deep tissue massage, especially with Ramji, although I am sure the others are great as well. One thing that I would recommend for Seeing Hands, as a few others have mentioned, is to keep speaking to a minimum and have some soothing meditative music playing. That would elevate the relaxation experience to another level. I can't wait for Tuesday... and Thursday... and Saturday... and even my last day, next Tuesday.
Seeing Hands, Patan. I have been goi regularly to the Seeing Hands Clonic in Patan and it has been really helpful and thorough massage. The therapist name is Ranji and he does an excellent job.

Wow. Visited the clinic in patan. Best massage of my life. Lovely therapists with big big heart. recommending to everyone! After visiting kathmandu several times, this clinic is definitely a must try even if you are in the city for short stay

Seeing hands literally!!. Its the best massage u can get as far as i am concerned. Its well located at quite peaceful area with nice warm friendly staff. Visually impaired masseur who are highly trained at what they do. Definitely have to check it out once.

Best massage in my life. I have been there once for a one-hour full-body massage and it was a great experience. The staff is very friendly and professional.I've had a tense a sore back for a few weeks and decided to get a massage in the hope that those knots could be undone. I have never had a massage where the masseuse pinpointed the sore areas so fast and so well. He was spot on very time.I would go back there any time when I need a massage and I definitively recommend it.

Such a good theraputic massage that I went back again the next day!. Laxmi found all the knots in my back.. impressive.. and for a good cause. I got lost, Seeing hands is on a small side road which you turn down between 2 travel agencies. Well worth the visit.
Excellent. Excellent place for a massage in Kathmandu! I definately recommend this place for a reasonably priced and very relaxig massage.

Wonderful massage. I had read how good this massage clinic is but I could not imagine how wonderful their massages and masseurs are. I was staying at the Himalaya Hotel and I asked for this clinic but instead they sent me to another massage parlour. On my way I got lost and I bumped into the Seeing Hands Clinic, which had been my first choice. I was welcomed by a extremely polite and gentle young man who explained me the procedure and made me feel confortable. The massage was strong - my choice- and very well done. I am usually very critical about masseurs and massage parlours but the massage here was very professional and the feeling was Wonderful.

Good massage. Really likable people. . I got the Swedish massage and I cannot remember my therapist by name, but he did an excellent job. Normally, I exclusively request a female message therapist but I knew this guy would know what he was doing, and I am glad I trusted him.My back feels great. I had really come in for a more feel-good massage, but the Swedish is evidently great for working out the tension in your back (albeit, a bit painful). Regardless, he did an excellent job in getting the tension out of the middle & upper parts of my back. This is was the kind of back work where you absolutely need to be able to trust your message therapist, and I'm glad I trusted this establishment. I hadn't really had my back worked on like that before, but I can tell I needed it in retrospect.They have three or four different massages for you to choose from so the nature of the massage is up to you.Nothing but respect and admiration for this place and my message therapist. I also think that if you haven't spent time around people who cannot see, it is well worth your time as I have so much respect for them. They seem like great people. Hope they do well. Look forward to coming back someday. I recommend checking this place out at least once.
Great place. I visited twice and it was really good. My therapist was Anmol. He spoke English very well and was very good at massage.

Excellent!. I have had back issues for last 10 years and have tried a lot of things. I practice a light routine of yoga and relaxation but when i discovered Seeing hands and Ramji it was like finding the missing link. I have been a regular visitor and I highly recommend anyone who works as hard as i do to go pamper yourself a bit every once in a while. We spend 1000s on things that are not good for us but very little on things that benefit us.

Perfect Massage!. This was one of the best massage experiences i've ever had in my life!
You have to try it when you get a chance to visit KTM. The therapists name was Santos and we had a great laugh to!

Wonderful. Really intuitive, friendly, and talented massage therapists here. They will ask you how much pressure you want, but be aware that more pressure is not always better, even if you can handle it. Encourage them to make those decisions based on what's best. We visited after the earthquake and the building was completely fine.

Best massage. After arriving back in Kathmandu from trekking to Everest Base Camp, Seeing Hands was the second place I headed to (first being the hotel for a hot shower!). Santos is an absolute wonder when it comes to massage, he knows exactly where your problems are you walk out feeling like a million dollars. Thank you Santos and the Seeing Hands team, looking forward to visiting you again next time I'm in Nepal.

Best massage I have had. EVER . I had heard about Seeing Hands on previous trips to Nepal but not managed to check it out until this time and I'm so glad I did. Laxmi my masseuse was amazing, she applied the perfect amount of pressure and found knots and bumps and pain that I didn't even realise I had; and then she fixed them! Absolute bliss! I wasn't sure if I wanted 90 minutes or an hour and retrospectively o wish I had gone for 90 minutes. I can't emphasise how great this massage was and how good I now feel (especially after a long trek in the Himalayas). I'm 100% going back for 90 minutes before I leave Nepal. This is the best thing I have done in Kathmandu and the whole ethos behind the organisation is so positive and something that everyone should support. Very reasonably priced, just fabulous.

Excellent Experience. Having done a short trek in the Annapurna range, I had a few sore muscles and was looking for a massage. I came across Seeing Hands and was immediately welcomed in, introduced around and brought in for a massage. The masseuse was incredibly polite, engaging and delivered an excellent massage. I wish I had found them earlier so I could have come back for another massage. Great program, and great experience.

just as its namesake. wonderful, went the first day. healing the jet lag and past work stress upon landing. prepping up for my joruney thru nepal! what can say, made the right decision. gaged my first glimpse into nepali life- whilst coming out refreshed! it was even better the next day after a good nights sleep. go to bimal - shes gifted! back knots untied!

An absolute must. Visited today, it was fantastic!! The team are extremely professional and experts at their jobs! Premises were immaculate! Left feeling relaxed, refreshed and rejuvenated!! Hope to return next week!!

5 Star Massage with Great Cause. I was walking by when i saw a tiny board for the Massage place and walked right in and Got myself Great Massage.Ganga Therapist was Extremely professional. Great Value for Money, Professional, Sweet and your money goes long way to help Blind folks.

The Miracle Works. Whatever you do whilst you are in Kathmandu, if you have any muscular stiffness or pains, you must visit Chiran at Seeing Hands Clinic. This man is a miracle worker, he has an amazing ability to connect with you on a spiritual level and feel the pain that you feel. Then he gives you the massage of your life and when he has finished you feel as though you have stepped into a brand new body. His talent for knowing EXACTLY where your pain is and how to work on it is uncanny.Chiran remembered me from my last visit in 2013, he recalled where I am from in the UK and all about the muscular problems that I had last time we met and even my daughters name.Chiran is totally blind, but God has given him a divine gift to heal others with his hands, and you should visit his clinic, not just because you are supporting an organisation that gives to work to the many blind and visually impared in Nepal, but because, this man can work miracles on your body.In fact they should rename it " The Miracle Works "
Good massage.. Great bunch of guys working there. Masseuse knew what he was doing plus had a great chat. Got the sports massage which was painful obviously but body felt good after.

The most amazing massage I have ever had. I was recommended this place by a good friend who said that the people here really know how to work magic and give you the best massage. I was told before I booked that there was not a female masseuse available but I was still happy to go ahead. I'm so glad I did as the gentleman who did my massage was incredible, he could tell exactly where my muscles were tense and was able to work them out with a consistent and comfortable pressure. The masseuse was very professional the whole was through and the prices are very reasonable. Without a doubt I would be more than happy to recommend seeing hands to any friends or family looking for a unique and amazing massage experience. Knowing that you are assisting blind people to earn their own living is also a reward in its own. Thank you seeing hands.
strong. really nice strong massage, i had a back problem for many monts and whit 2 hours massage it is allmoust gone!!be aware, if you ask for strong it is really strong

Deep sports massage - really great.. Went at the end of three weeks in Nepal - the talented masseuse worked wonders on my aching back and tired legs. Checked frequently whether the pressure was right (very firm took out bunches of knots/tired muscles), clean safe facility, fab value for money (1500 rupees - $15).

Very impressed!. Thank you for an amazing set of three massages I had during my stay in Pokhara. I am also a Sports and Remedial massage therapist and was very impressed at the professional quality of the therapists skills. The friendly and caring environment also ensures you are well taken care of, I'll be recommending Seeing Hands to everyone I know to support this fantastic team!

Very competent, best massage in years. This is the place to go for a quality massage (this is confirmed by expat citizen of Kathmandu). It's a low key, no nonsense type of place. Laxmi (in Thamel clinic) had an amazing way to find all the sore spots and I felt very well taken care of.

Highly recommend!. So glad I made time to have a massage at seeing hands whilst in Nepal. My therapist Bibek was friendly and professional. I had the sports massage. It was amazing! Bibek was always checking I was ok and if the pressure was ok. He found all my problem areas. I've never had such a fantastic massage, my back felt so free and relaxed after. Thank you Seeing Hands :)

Fantastic treatment and staff (Bakhundol, Patan branch). My partner and I have had about 10 massages at Seeing Hands in Bakhundol during our few months in Nepal. We started going not long after the branch opened and it has turned into a regular weekend visit. All the staff are very friendly and welcoming. Our masseuses - Ram for me and Lalu for Caroline - have been simply excellent. Their treatments are first class and they are always careful to concentrate on any areas that are troubling us. We have had our treatment in the same room and in separate rooms - they will do whatever is most comfortable for you. The rooms are kept nice and warm (good at this time of year!). The price is a more than reasonable 1500rps (£10) - hard to find a reason not to go for that price and the standard of treatment. We highly recommend them so do yourself a favour and treat yourself.
Absolutely smashing time!. My boyfriend and I went for a massage and we were blown away by how amazing it was. Well worth the money and an unforgettable experience. Would do again in a heartbeat.

Excellent Massage In Central Patan. I have been going to SeeingHands for about 2 months now regularly to see Ramji. Since being there I have always got first class sports massage in a friendly and professional atmosphere. Ramji has worked hard on a muscle problem I have in my lower back and I can say confidently it is feeling so much better! As a runner getting a regular massage for me has been great for stopping injuries and such a quality massage is hard to find anywhere else in KTM, especially for such a great price. Well done to Ramji and the rest of the team! I will keep coming back!

Just what was needed after mountaineering trip. My wife and I visited a week after summiting Himlung. To say we were a bit frazzled / worn out was an understatement. We'd used Seeing Hands in Phnom Penh several years ago so we looked no further amongst all the venues offering massage in KTM. We originally booked for 60 minutes but...after much work on our backs / shoulders we asked that it be extended to 90 minutes. My wife is a sports therapist, she knows her stuff when it comes to massage. We both rated this very highly and walked out somewhat pummelled and dazed, but in a far better state of tune. Many thanks to Ganga and Laxmi, all the best Jamie and Clare.

Wow! Best ever!. I'm both sad and pleased that I only found this place just a few days before I left Kathmandu! Sad as it means I only got two massages, pleased because otherwise it would have cost me a fortune!!I'd just come back from 10 days Vipassana meditation and my shoulders and back really needed some work - REALLY needed it!Laxmi worked her magic hands on all the knots - a deep massage that really helped.Two days later I went back for a relaxing massage before leaving Kathmandu.I really can't recommend enough. All the staff are lovely and friendly, the facilities are clean and the price is good - not the cheapest in town - but you get what you pay for :)

One of best massages I've ever had. I get massages all the time (probably over 200 to date), and this one definitely ranks up in my top five. The therapists are trained to truly be masters. With targeted touch and specific focus, Ramji was able to loosen up tension and reduce knots & pain in my back that very few have done before. Highly, highly recommend. And the added bonus is that it's a great cause, but would recommend even if that was not the case.

Best Massage Ever!!!!. I highly recommend getting a massage here before you leave. We all got massages at Seeing Hands after getting off of our flights from the States. I get weekly massages in New York, and this by far trumps anything I've had. Ram was completely intuned with every knot, kink, and swell. He massaged, hit trigger points, and stretched. It is so evident that the therapists are trained in human anatomy/physiology, because his knowledge of muscle skeletal connectivity was exceptional. He was professional, thorough, and spoke perfect English. I will definitely try to return before leaving!!!

Best massage in Patan. I had a one hour body massage after a hard kayaking trip. Ramji, who did the massage, was a competent and very pleasant guy who also taught me some of the basics of a good massage. The price is great (perhaps even a bit too low; I would gladly pay more if it meant higher salaries, too). It's conveniently placed close to Pulhowk Road, right opposite to the Norwegian Embassy, so that it's to get to). Highly recommended.They've just opened up this branch in Patan, so right now it's nice and quiet in a house with a beautiful courtyard.

MORE than "the best of the best" ;
La crème de la crème. Got massaged many times before this one by professional sport massage person. Well , this one is by far the most sharp , and healing. Humbly and highly recommended. Bonus is that the all staff is so nice warm and welcoming. Renald.

Best massage ever!. Friends had recommended the seeing hands clinic and we only have one disappointment that we didn't discover it earlier.They are such professionals and I can honestly say it was the best massage myself and my partner have had. In particular the male massage professional identified and worked through my partners back pain talking him through it the whole time.Please go and support these amazing people you won't be disappointed!

Amazing Healing Hands. I was struggling to find proper massage place in Thamel as most of them looks dodgy. Then i searched in the net and found seeing hands clinic. I immediately go there and had 60mins swedish massage. My therapist Laksmi was amazing, she's gentle and friendly and she found all my pain points even without me telling her. I came out of the place fully relaxed and all my back pain from trekking gone! If you are in Nepal and looking for a good massage, please go to seeing hands. Highly recommended!
A great welcome to Kathmandu . The masseuse was freindly. The massage was invigorating yet relaxing. The room was clean. And the cause is a great one. Why wouldn't you go?!

Great post-trek massage. My boyfriend and I got massages here after EBC. We had gotten another massage several weeks before and this one was by far better. I don't get massages so often so I can't speak to the technique, but it just felt good. Aside from that, the people were so nice, spoke excellent English, were friendly and the place was clean.

Heavenly relaxation. My wife and I had a 60 min massage in the same room. My therapist, Santos, was able to pinpoint the problematic areas just by feeling the muscles. It was one of the best massages I've had. He also speaks English well.

great massage after trekking. visited Seeing Hands in Pokhara after I completed ABC. Blind therapist Govinda was excellent and the massage was great value for money. The room is clean and comfortable.

Wonderful experience at end of trek. Was recommended this place by a work colleague & it didn't disappoint, Just around the corner from the Gaia Café & our hotel in Thamel it was easy to find. The masseurs explained the process very well & were always asking if the massage was the correct strength & if everything was ok.Walked out relaxed & very happy with the massage. The people there also seemed to enjoy their work.

Great!. I concur with all the other accolades given, this place is awesome! Located conveniently within Thamel, we walked in and were relieved there was availability given there are only 5 therapists working at the Kathmandu branch. The massage was good and professional. We particularly found the room to be more pleasant than the more expensive Tranquillity Spa at Pokhara which was dark and not ventilated. Everyone should give it a try!

Excellent massage. Excellent massage and you feel that you are helping a very worthy cause.We had a sports massage for 60 mins and the cost was only 1800 rupees or about 19 USD. You could also opt for a relaxing Swedish style massage.A ninety minute massage was 2400 rupees.

Seeing hands massage. Absolutely excellent massage. The staff are fully trained and professional. The costs was 1,800 rupees for 60 mins. That is about USD 19. The cost for 90 mins was 2,400 rupees.Not only do you get an excellent massage you also feel that you are supporting a good cause.
Best massage ever!. Best 90 min massage ever! Not expensive at all.Totally recommend! Close to Thamel main street shops.Please visit if you have a change.

Best Massage in Kathmandu!. I visited once again to Seeing Hands clinic and had truly the best massage ever ... Laxmi took care of me this time and her hands were sure and confident and she massaged all the cricks and knots away that had collected from the bumpy roads and excessive walking! I appreciate the quality as I regularly have massages at home, and am quite picky about what is good or not ;-) so I was thankful that once again I received excellent massages (twice this visit!) and the friendly atmosphere of the clinic too ... beautiful!

wellness by seeing hands. Thank you it was an over the top experience:-) We were treated so well and all the tension in neck, shoulder and back were relieved by these fantastic seeing hands. Highly recommend and all the best from Ida and Karin.
great massage. my husband and I both had sore necks and backs so we went to this clinic. we walked out an hour later feeling great. thanks

Chiran has done wonders for my back and neck!. I told Chiran about certain issues I have with muscle-strains and he was able to relieve me of very much tension. My therapist realized professional hands had been at work once I had returned home again.

Wow!. I really really loved this place for a massage! The massage therapist was fantastic and really hit the right spots. And the staff was so friendly and helpful.The only thing to complain about is that the room was a bit cold and it would've been lovely to take a shower afterwards. Other than that, I can highly recommend this place.

Perfect, worth a visit!!. As a masseuse myself all I can say is that I truly loved the massage. Therapists are kind, professional and attentive. Lakshmi was my therapist and she did a great job, always making sure that the pressure was adecuate for me. 60 min that went by so fast!! I truly enjoyed it and will definitely be back when I come back to Nepal!

Amazing. It is the fourth times I visited Nepal in last December and finally managed to find time to enjoy massage in Pokhara. Seeing Hand Clinic is one of which I know of for some time and I visited there on 26/12/2013 and 27/12/2013 (and have 2x of massages). It is really beyond my expectation to receive such skillful massage/therapy as I do not anticipate the therapist (blind) would be able to detect the problems of my back and shoulder without me signalling a word (as I do have very frequent of massage "tui na" to solve my backache, sniffing neck and shoulder pain back in my home country). It is really amazing!I would highly recommend Seeing Hands Clinic for massage or therapy if you guys have a chance to visit Pokhara and Kathmandu. The rate offers is very reasonable. Each therapist is well-trained with their certificate display in the reception area. More importantly, lets support them for their surviving skills. Well done!

Great massage. After trekking to Everest Base Camp I was in desperate need of a massage especially my shoulders, neck and back, and calf muscles. I was allocated the masseuse Anmol, and he didn't disappoint. He had firm hands and repeatedly went over the problems areas. The time wasn't enough so I went back agai the second day. Thanks to Anmol, he was incredibly professional and solved my sore shoulder problems. I highly recommend him.

Excellent!. I have stay in Thailand for many years, and I go for massage regularly to relieve my shoulders pain. But the problem still there.Just now I went to seeing hand, and I had a great massage by Anmol! He can quickly notice my problem and gave me a Good massage!I recommend seeing hand to everyone who look for the real and excellent massage!Thanks!

Awesome!. Initially went in looking for a good massage and to support a good initiative . My girlfriend and I left after having an amazing massage and supporting what I think is a great initiative :) Definitely recommend this to all visiting Kathmandu. Chances are you will need a massage anyhow ;)

Update to previous review. I previously gave seeing hands 2 stars because I did not receive a full massage. The manager, Chiran, tracked me down through mutual contacts and offered me a complimentary massage to make up for it. Chiran gave me the massage himself and it was great. I am happy they addressed the issue and I am going back again.

good massage, great people. I went with my friend (a fysiotherapist) to seeing hands, after he recommended it to me. The people there we most friendly and helpful. Also during the massage my masseuse was very keep on keeping me comfortable, asking me about any fysical problems and my overall well-being. If you want a good and remedial massage, choose this wonderful clinic!

very strong, good knowledge. Got a good, strong massage by Anmol. Got one before, and after my three weeks of trekking and it was just what I needed. At home I work as a physical therapist and we both refreshed our knowledge of the muscle names and locations.Some parts were a little intense for me, for instance the neck and calf muscles, I told the therapist to lower the intensity of the massage a little bit. Can't say that I tried more massage places, because I did't need to. Go to seeing hands for a professional, good massage.

Well worth a visit.......... Thanks to Santosh for a wonderful massage in Khatmandu. After 10 days trekking in the Himalayas it was just what was needed. I heartily recommend Seeing Hands to all who visit the city.After your session, pop round the corner to Kilroy's restaurant for a meal you'll remember. Great, diverse menu and good service. For your outdoor clothing or kit go visit Shona's, just across the road from Kilroy's. Good, honest trading.

made me want to move there... i had several amazing massages at Seeing Hands, both in Pokhora and Kathmandu. Each masseuse was skilled and friendly. the massage was some of the best i have had and i have had many all over the world. They found all the places that needed massage and made me feel great by the end of the session. If you need special attention on certain areas, just ask and they will happily work out the knots. I seriously miss these massages and for the price i couldnt stay away. other places charge around the same if not more, but none match their quality and cleanliness. please go!

It's ok, all for a good cause. After trying jiva at pokhara, I went to kathmandu the next day. Saw the reviews on TripAdvisor about this place so I gave it a go. I like the idea some of the profit is used to train more blind therapists. The customer service was great. I opted for a swedish massage. My therapist was new (so she said). The room looked nice and clean. But it could have used music to make it more relaxing. Therapist relies on a device to tell her what time it is. I felt she spent too much time massaging my upper back and so the other areas were a bit rushed. ..Overall it's not bad

Not a full massage. I paid for a 90 minute massage and all I received was a back massage with a hurried massage of the back of my legs ONLY. No arms, no front of legs, no head, barely any chest. When I complained they did nothing.

Just what the doctor ordered. This is the first time I have ever given a review on trip advisor, usually I just forget to make the time and then just never do it. Strange as I use it every time we are booking a hotel , always researching on trip advisor for all our hotel and activity choices . Well this time Ive decided to join trip advisor and tell the world about how I feel about this "seeing hands clinic" ! I was lucky enough to visit 2 times in a month, once before and once after some serious trekking, both times I loved every moment , Laxmi is incredible! She really understands and knows how to read your body , and course to perform an amazing massage . I seriously felt like a new person after each session . I've certainly had my fare share of massages and can confidently say these guys know what they are doing. I have told everybody who will listen to come to the clinic . Amazing place with an amazing price , an absolute pleasure. The staff are all such lovely warm people and the clinic is very comfortable and clean. The experience was perfection !!

A good massage, not too hard to find.. I was treated by Santoss, a 26 year old man with excellent technique, who provided strong pressure as requested, but ensured I wasn't uncomfortable at any time.The facilities are clean, and the staff are cheerful and speak excellent English, as well as a couple of other languages.To find the premises, ask for popular Gaia's Restaurant, (which is off busy Jayatha), and walk around the next corner 15 metres further on.Phone : 01 465 786. Mobile : 98460 39918You won't be disappointed receiving a massage from these sensitive blind people.

Brilliant experience!. I was persuaded by my better half to visit Seeing Hands - at 30 years old it was time for my first massage! Ramji was an absolute wizard - he went easy on me and expertly popped all my joints, would recommend this place to anyone! The 60 minute couples massage is great and made very enjoyable by Ramji's capable English and wicked sense of humour!
Fantastic. Best massage ever. I regularly have massages, but the knowledge and attention to each muscle was on another level. My guy was called Santosh.

Outstanding Massage!. I visited the Seeing Hands Massage Clinic located in Kathmandu during my trip in September and October of 2013. Ramji provided an outstanding sports therapy massage. He is exceptionally well-trained and spoke outstanding English. My lower back and legs were quite sore from trekking the previous two weeks and Ramji successfully worked out almost all of the tightness and soreness. If you are looking for a relaxing massage to put you to sleep definitely do not go for the sports therapy massage! However, if you want to work out the knots and soreness from your body Seeing Hands is an outstanding option.

90 minutes of the best massage ever.. After an action packed 10 days of trekking and safari, a friend recommended that my girlfriend and I try this massage clinic. In fact he'd been singing their praises all week that we had to go. We had 90 minutes of sports massage (on adjacent tables) where Ramji and Laxsmi worked out all our knots and stresses with incredible skill. We really did leave feeling like new people.Incredible value, especially when compared to UK charges and durations. A must for all visiting Kathmandu!

Fantastic massage, amazing all round experience. I went to this clinic after trekking to Everest Base Camp. I had an amazing remedial massage, and a fantastic chat with one of the blind masseurs - Santosh. My back felt much better afterwards, I felt completely safe and at ease during the massage, it was fantastic value for money and I would definitely go back if I find myself in Kathmandu once more. The two other people I was with from my trek had a similar experience.

physio therapy clinic. therapists with special tactile.. the blind are naturally talented masseuses. this group is so friendly, warm, and kind. the facility is decorated by one of the best hotels in NEPAL.

Excellent massage. My daughter (14) and I, had twice an excellent massage at the Seeing Hands clinic.
First time 1 hour,second time 1 hour 30.
The therapists are very friendly people and the ambiance in the clinic is full of joy (with Laxmi's baby Serene passing from hand to hand...)
A great place for a great cause.
Patricia&Youli Horovitz.Tel-Aviv Israel

Wish I got 90 mins. After hearing about this organization in Pokhara we decided to visit the Kathmandu location as it was next to our hotel. Back in Canada I see a registered massage therapist once a month and this was just as good if not better. The therapist found all sorts of knots and worked through them. I only wish we had more time so she could do a full body and get my legs! If you have the choice btwn pokhara and kathmandu I might try pokhara only because you might not hear people screaming on the streets. All in all though it was great.

It's the real thing!!. I had just finished a trek and chose Seeing hands for a massage. I was amazed by the experience and felt blissful at the end of it. Lalu my therapist was fantastic- she had magic hands and was really friendly as well.I can truly say it was one of he best massages I have ever had. She worked through all the right places to relieve the stress and tension- obviously very well trained The massage room itself is very pleasant and comfortable. So if you have some time,want to have a great massage and help a good cause I would recommend you visit Seeing hands.

Awesome Massage and a New Shoulder. We visited the clinic just from walking past and decided it was a worthwhile cause. Little did I know that I would get the best massage I have ever had and get my shoulder fixed at the same time. My massage was done by Chiran and he did a excellent job. I have dislocated my shoulder twice so my shoulder has been an issue for some time. I did four sessions with him and my shoulder feels amazing. It was much better after the second session and he started working on other areas more. The first session was spent purely on my shoulder. There were some times of heavy pain during the treatment as he went deep into the shoulder joint where the issues were, but it was definately worth it. I could not sleep on that shoulder for many years as it would hurt too much. I no longer have that problem and have a new confidence with my shoulder. I was always worried about putting my arm straight up in the air of fear of it dislocating it. That issue is also fixed. I have a new shoulder and will not get surgery on my shoulder which I was considering. Thanks Chiran for all your hard work. Amazing.

Amazing massage for a great cause. we went to pokhars and had a fabulous massage at the clinic and have now had a great massage in Kathmandu. I had my back neck and shoulders massaged by Lalu. It was so good my husband and I are going back tonight and tomorrow.

Excelent choice. There are many options to get a massage in Kathmandu, but this is one of the best. Not only because you get a great massage in the hands of true professionals and also very friendly, but also because you are helping a good cause, helping people to earn an honest living in a place where job opportunities perhaps are not as good for blind people.

For real massage 'Seeing Hands Clinic'. I stayed a month in Kathmandu on the edge of Thamel in this lovely Souvenir Guesthouse of which the owner advised me to visit the Seeing Hands Clinic for the best massage in town. Just passed and behind where restaurant Gaya is located. He was right, I have got the best massage over there which made me so enthusiastic I decided to make a video clip about the clinic. The people who are giving the massage are so pure and radiating positive energy, they are remarkable. They are blind but very skilled and speak very good English. Not to compare to all of the fake massage parlors in Kathmandu where rubbing smelly oil and happy endings is what they are trying to sell in a dirty, terribly filthy setting.Walking for hours in a stinking city which Kathmandu not so charmingly really is, a great massage at Seeing Hands made me new and vibrant again to happily go on another of my walks through this crowded and dirty city where beauty can be found where you least expect it.Willem Rieder

Best Massage of my Life!!!Life changing!. My family and i were in Kathmandu for a few days and i was desperate for a massage after our trekking trip. Our Hotel recommended us a spa near by and i had a very bad massage from untrained staff. I was disappointed. So i looked up on the web and came across "Seeing hands" and read up about them onTripadvsior. My sister and i decided to try a massage and visited the "seeing hands" clinic. What really got us was the sentence that they receive a 2 year training from Uk doctors. I had a male Massage therapist and i really didn't know what to expect. I never received a massage from a blind person before.I can say that it was hands down the best massage of my life.( i get a lot of massages as i spend a lot of time in asia) It was a very healing experience. He felt my body and the tight spots and worked through it. He was gentle, his english was perfect and he seemed like a very nice young man. One can really feel how sensitive and experienced the massage therapist are at seeing hands. Obviously their condition gives them a higher sensitivity for feeling. We extended while we are being massaged to a 1.5 houer session because it was that amazing. I could have done 4 hours. Seriosuly im already looking forward to come back to Kathmandu just to get this massage again. You are silly not to try it. It will change your life. Enjoy!

Awesome massage, it put me be back to life!. After long days of trekking and motorcycling through Nepal my back and legs were completely destroyed. After the massage I felt completely reborn even though I must admit that it has been painful in certain moments...

Bliss!. After a long flight to Kathmandu and reading all the reviews here on tripadvisor, a visit to Seeing Hands was moved to near the top of my to-do list. I arrived at the centre near closing time, but ended up having the most wonderful massage (from Ramji ). It was so good, that I made a return visit a few days later! The Seeing Hands Centre in Kathmandu is easy to find and its only a five minute walk from the "Garden of Dreams". If you are visiting Kathmandu - make time to visit Seeing Hands - you will not regret it!!

Great Massage. I came to Nepal with some body issues and was hoping to find a legitimate massage therapist here. I found Seeing Hands, and have had three massages with them from two different therapists. Without a doubt some of the best massages I've had anywhere in the world. They are professional, knowledgeable and follow directions well. And it's a great cause. I totally recommend it. I only did the therapeutic massage, but imagine they would do a good relaxation massage too.

A Great Find. My wife and I were searching for a place to get massages after our trek. We came across the Seeing Hands Clinic on tripadvisor. Which is better, the cause or the massage? I don't know. Both are amazing. I got a 90 minute sports massage from Ramji and my wife received the same from Laxmi. This would be our 3rd massage (first in KTM). To say we were disappointed, would be an understatement. SHC are clearly trained well. There was PNF stretching and really deep work. It was just what we needed.

Wow!. The massage I had at Seeing Hands was more than perfect! I had a lot of tension in my little body and right now it's totally gone! I really recommend this to all people who want to have one of the best massages you could have in your life! Love to Seeing Hands <3Bye Ellis

A real massage like I haven't had one in years, a gem of a find.. I went to Seeing Hands for the experience and was rewarded with simply the most professional massage therapy I've had in years. This is the place to go for a real treatment from some of the best trained and most qualified therapists around. In addition, this is a magnificent social enterprise training the next generation of therapists in a demanding 8 month long programme, providing a good livelihood in a country with little support for disabled people.

Perfect holiday massage. The masseurs are blind, and so this takes away any embarrassment one might have in being on a massage table! I had a Swedish massage with my sister. We had two masseurs and the tables were side by side. It was great to hear the joy in the voices of the masseurs as they chatted. Whilst my sister can speak Nepali, their English was very good, so I could understand all I needed. The massage was firm, even though my masseur, Raju said he was only using 20% of his strength. I found it very powerful...I don;t think I could handle 100%!! This was well worth the visit.

Great guys, very professional. I've been there with a friend. Both of us have had a great healing massage with Ramji and Lalu. The incredible thing is they are really young but very very very well trained. Great job. Great experience and they are very nice guys too. But I repeat myself, the massage was perfect, not one of those unuseful oily spa massages. No frills here, but you will got out with a new back!Go on like that guys!

An amazing massage and a good cause. I received 1h30 massage by Ramsi who was very professional, knowledgeable, attentive and kind. He did a fantastic job on my back as he was able to find all the knots and did his best to make them disappear. I had a fantastic experience which I deeply recommend. Everyone in the clinic was so nice. It felt very special to be there.

Memorable and Inspiring. What a wonderful place and wonderful people. I had a bad injury that was basically healed by my now new friends here. They repeatedly turned out opportunities to charge me more - such as when I asked whether a longer massage would help, or whether I should return the next day. They clearly care deeply about helping and healing. It is all the more inspiring that this is serving the visually impaired community. This is by far the best massage I have ever received, and one of the true highlights of my time in Kathmandu. Thank you - I just wish I could spend more time supporting this organization and benefiting from the incredible healing you provide.
Hour-long massage on July 28 with Ramji. I had a wonderful experience this past Sunday evening during my massage with Ramji. He was great. I highly recommend "Seeing Hands." I'll definitely go back!

Excellent massage by professional masseur. I had a 90 minute remedial deep tissue massage on 23 July, done by Ramji. He was very polite, friendly, professional and attentive. I left the place feeling great! This is easily the best massage I have ever had.
Very pleasent and talented personell. Nice and clean, pleasent and talented personell. Knew what he was doing, and pleasent to talk to. Definetly recomendable!

Best Massage Ever. I went for a deep muscle massage on the 16th of July 2013 and it was fantastic. The masseurs really knew their stuff. They were polite friendly halpful and eager to help.I play a lot of sport and cycle a lot so Ramsi (the masseur) spent an hour on my legs. They feel great now. He found all the knots.I would highly recommend this spa.

Best Massage. Excellent massage and half the fees goes back to helping the blind! Highly recommended for all, my masseur knew all the knots from his touch, and cleared all of them for me. Great skills!

Fantastic post-trek massage. My hotel, the excellent Hotel Friends Home (nearby), recommended this place. I'm very glad I asked for their recommendation. I found it easily (near the Hotel Fuji) and was assigned Lalu (Labu?), friendly woman. I know massages very well since I live in Bangkok and I get proper massages all the time from some very good people. And Lalu's massage was up there with the best. In fact, I'd have to say it was the perfect post-trek massage, because she knew all the spots that would be hurting after a trek (calves, quads, back, shoulders etc). Frankly, I'd give just about anything to be back on that table now.

Fantastic massage, Western quality!. Had a 1hr Swedish massage by Lalu in KTM. So friendly, repeatedly asked if pressure was ok, found all my trouble spots- was AMAZING! Definitely recommend and would go back. Bring exact change if tipping.

Seeing hands,open hearts. myself and my boyfriend attended the clinic this morning for a one hr massage each.after struggling to find the clinic as it is just off the main jayatha street down a very quiet alleyway.we were greeted by name with such a friendly approach as we entered the building.the room was clean and all the towels used were fresh.we were both in the same room which suited us.i have to say Lalu and Santos the people providing the massage were so polite and considerate at all times.always asking if the pressure was ok or If we had any special requirements.the massage lasted an hr and I have yet to receive such a good massage in Ireland.it wAs brilliant and I would recommend it as top of the list of things to do in Thamel or Pokhara.Santos and Lalu were lovely,had a great level of English and a brilliant sense of humour and most of all were excellent at their job

Best massage in ages. I stumbled upon the place the night before I had to leave town, went in the morning just before my flight, and my regret is not having discovered Seeing Hands earlier. The facility is very professional and clean, with high quality massage beds and in hygenic and comfortable rooms. I had a sports massage with Lalu, and she rubbed all the knots out of my back in no time. Admittedly I don't frequently get massages, but I got two in Pokhara, and Seeing Hands (which also operates in Pokhara) is clear and away the best of the lot. Highly recommended!

Excellent facility. I visited Seeing Hands in Kathmandu today for the first time and was thoroughly impressed. I had a hr long sports massage for 1500 rupees with Laxmi and it was one of the best massages I've had. If you are visiting Karhmandu and have a spare hr or two this is a great way of supporting the local blind Nepalise people.
Awesome massage. Went twice in my time Kathmandu. Can be a little difficult to find so write down the directions before you leave home because it is well worth it. Thank you seeing hands.

excellent massage by Laxmi. The deep tissue massage I had by Laxmi was one of the best I have ever had- she was so skilled! My tight and sore muscles were completely relaxed by the end of the session.

Even better than last time!. While in Nepal this March/April 2013 I once again (& friends!) visited to the seeing hands clinic to receive a massage ... in fact two times this visit! One massage by Laxmi and one by Chrion ... and both massage were even better than the last time I wrote a review here ... not only do they give a really good quality massage, the clinic is clean, the atmosphere uplifting, but I also know it really helps this small blind community have their own independence by their social entrepreneur business. Would highly recommend visiting them for a massage if you are in Thamel, Kathmandu, Nepal. Make sure you call them by phone and book first as they are getting busy now during the tourist season.

Massage Therapy Seeing Hands. Great Clinic that offers well trained Remedial Massage Therapist who are passionate about their work.As a massage therapist myself I can highly recommend them.Also they are a legitimate massage clinic unlike most of the massage places offering massage around Kathmandu.Santosh was my therapist on 3 occassions and also Laksmi massage my other friend. Not only will you receive a great massage you are helping to support this organisation who are happy to support , train and employ the best massage therapists.in Kathmandu and Pokhara.They do have a room that can accommodate 2 people at a time so its a great way to chill out with friends or a partner. Highly recommend it.

Terrific Remedial Massage. Living and working in Asia, I have experienced just about every type of massage you can imagine.Seeing hands is professional and thorough. I had Chiren for my massage. He asked a few questions regarding my general well being and if there were any problem areas. He then quickly got to work targeting problem areas. The massage I had was deep tissue so I expected some discomfort.The relief afterwards was definitely worth any discomfort.Can highly recommend this place.

The Worlds Best Remedial Massage. A massage here is a great way of helping some of the 160,00 blind people in Nepal and thats the reason that I personally went there.All the masseurs are blind, both men and women. I arrived in a good deal of pain and unable to walk, so I booked a massage with the proprietor, ' Chiren ', and I am not kidding when I say,"I bet this man can walk on water !", after a one hour massage I was able to walk again and had nowhere the amount of pains as when I arrived there. Chiren knows exactly where your pain is and works hard on you to get rid of it. The next day I was a little sore but by the following day all the soreness had gone and I was feeling good, so good in fact, that I went back to him three days later for a second session, I am now back in the UK and still feeling the benefits of his massages. Whilst I cannot say that his massage cured my chronic pain, which after all, is age related, but it did go a long way to releiving it and allowing me some small mobility. Chiren speaks excellent English and has a good sense of humour and a highly professional attitude.Do yourself a BIG favour, if you have any stiffness or nerve pain go to 'Seeing Hands', and get yourself the message to end all massages, it won't cost you a fortune and is worth every Ruppee !

Great Massage. I had a first-class massage with Santiago who was very professional, friendly and was absolutely able to pin point my tight areas and help relieve them. I definitelyely recommend this place.

Well done. I enjoy trying out new massage therapists when I travel and especially wanted to support the work behind Seeing Hands after hiking. It wasn’t real easy to find as I couldn’t see any sign on the main street pointing to the right alley. Once I arrived, I was greeted by Santosh, who asked if I preferred a male or female therapist, so there is that option (personally, I don’t care as long as they’re good at it). He took me up to a private room. Unfortunately, he wasn’t able to find a heater for the room so we moved to a table in a room that already had a client on the other table. I was concerned that there would be a lot of conversation between the two therapists as noted in reviews for the Pokhara clinic, but it was kept to a minimum. There was, however, some loud discussion between the other therapist and someone outside the door (I think about gas delivery?); as a massage veteran, I feel the massage room should be a sanctuary without interruption from the outside world.Santosh was a good massage therapist with very firm pressure, to the point of pain on my overworked calf muscles, but he eased up when requested. All in all, it was a good experience and very good value on many levels.
Seeing Hands Massage Clinic Kathmandu. Great place for massage by trained blind people. Wonderful after a trek.Great deep tissue massage. I had Chiren and my sister had his wife - both excellent

Unique and must do experience. A bit confronting at first but otherwise an excellent massage. Rooms were basic but clean. Masseurs English was fantastic. Chiran provided a very insightful massage- highly reccommend

Truly hands that see!. The masseuse was very good with the deep tissue massage and truly hit every problem area i had on my shoulders and back. Speaks excellent English, and a good sense of humour. Highly recommend you spend your massage budget here than anywhere else, and go on and help a good cause.
best massage in nepal. this is a great place, very friendly, professional and.. human. if you need a real massage in kathmandu or pokhara, this is the place.

Better than new!. I had two massages during my stay in Nepal and they did absolute wonders. I've had a few blind massages before but this places takes the cake. My masseuse found knots and areas of needed "attention" in places I was completely unaware of. The atmosphere is very friendly and relaxed. They all speak very good English and understand everything said to them so that they can attend to any need you have. I highly highly recommend going to Seeing Hands on your next trip! Great for getting away from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu while doing something for yourself and a good cause!!
Strength of kings, hands of wizards. Had a massage from Chiran that was amazing, no holding back. He went for it and wasn't afraid to work the cheeks. Highly recommended!

Massage with a purpose. Wonderful massage by highly professional polite staff. My friend found seeing hands through trip advisor and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Kathmandu. It was lovely to get away from the hustle and bustle of Thamel for an hour of indulgence. Although I'm a massage novice, my friend said that this rated highly compared to massages back home. As well as being a great massage it was lovely to know the good that this enterprise is doing for the people who run it, especially after living in Kathmandu for two months and seeing how difficult life for people with disabilities, especially female, is there.

Great Cause and Great Massage!. I by accident discoverd the seeing hands clinic in Kathmandu. I bookt a massage for 90 minutes. I told the therapist, who spoke fluent englisch, what my problems where and he thoroughly attended to them. He is better than my fisiotherapist and better than my ostheopat. I was also very touched by there extremely polite personality. If you visit Nepal you must visit Seeing hands!!

Excellent massage and a good cause.. We went twice during a short stay in Kathmandu and found Seeing Hands fantastic. I'm a bit of a novice in having massages, but my travel companion Tash is a connoisseur in this space and gave SH several Michelin Stars! Will be back when next in Kathmandu.

Good value, enjoyable and worthwhile. It seemed to me that, if I was going to pamper myself with a massage in Kathmandu, it would be preferable to spend the money with a company that tries to create wider benefits for Nepali people. This is a very professional operation and the lady who massaged me was clearly very knowledgeable and experienced. She had the most lovely soothing voice that I've ever heard. I thoroughly enjoyed the massage and it came with an additional feelgood factor of knowing that it was part of a project designed to improve career options for blind people.

first-rate service, well-trained staff, excellent value. I was suffering from chronic, lower back pain and wary of notorious "massage parlors" in Thamel, Kathmandu, but a friend recommended "Seeing Hands." They were professional, their English was fluent and they impressed me with a very vigorous, deep, sport-medicine-style, thorough massage. My back is on it's way to healing for the first time in a long time. The very personable, young man, from Lumbini, Ramji, treated me, and I would not hesitate to recommend him in particular. Thanks again Ramji!-Brett Johnson, USA

Great Massage. This was listed on trip advisor so we decided to give it a try. We made our reservations by phone from our hotel. No one had ever heard of the place, we had a heck of a time finding it. It seemed a little seedy when we first arrived, but the massage was divine. I recommend the sports massage to get out the kinks from the plane ride.

Great value and experience. I can only say I know two things very well - tea and massages. I loved the experience at Seeing Hands. The masseur targeted injured muscles quicker than someone with sight and he solely worked on those muscles. One of the best massages I have ever experienced. Highly recommend.

Much needed massage. After my trek I needed a massage so went to the clinic - it was good and lasted an hour. The masseur was good, he had excellent English and chatted freely during the massage. He asked to tell him if he was hurting me and when I told him I did he reduced the pressure. The reception was well organized and the staff very friendly. It was clear from where he concentrated his efforts where he found knots and worked hard to remove them - it was a good experience and I was pleased to support this worthwhile endeavour.

Great massage. I had a great massage at Seeing Hands Clinic.My masseur, Ramji, was really good ... Great technique and English.He has been interviewed 3 times before got accepted there.Highly recommended. Wish I can come back for more massage.

Interesting experience and quite good. I went for a sports massage having a neck/ shoulder that had gone into spasm. It was a painful massage but did relieve the pain slightly. Unfortunately the problem was too serious to be cured by the massage, but I did realise that when I subsequently went to see a physio, the points that the Seeing Hands masseuse had recognised as problem points, were the correct points which the physio also focused on. It was also an interesting experience so worth a try either for relaxation or therapy.

Best massage I ever had. I went to the Seeing Hands massage twice during my stay in Kathmandu and I could have gone every day - Ramji did a wonderful job with his massages! I felt like in heaven afterwards. It's worth every Rupee you have to spare!

Excellent massage. After a visit to the Seeing Hands Clinic in Pokhara, when I got back from Everest, I received a massage from Ramji at the Seeing Hands Clinic in Kathmandu.It was as excellent as excellent as the massage was in Pokhara, I would definitely go again and would highly recommend this place for a good quality, very reasonably priced massage.Enjoy!

Marvelous Massage. My husband and I read the reviews then decided to try Seeing Hands Clinic. We were not disappointed in this small out of the way place, sincere nice staff, very helpful and attentive. We had a massage in the same room, they were knowledgeable and mindful of any injuries and / or request. It really was a marvelous and a really great price (less than most) that contributes to a good cause + you get a great massage...good overall experience.

Wonderful !!!!. We LOVED the Seeing Hands Clinic. We went to get a massage before our trek and it was absolutely wonderful..... the clinic was down a quieter alley in Thamel so that was nice and the place was clean. The therapists were just wonderful and did a great job. We liked it so much we tried to find the one in Pokhara (but kept walking the wrong direction so never found it unfortunately)..... but then we returned again to this on in Thamel after our trek. My only minor complaint was that during our massage (my husband and I were in the same room) the 2 therapists talked to each other quite a bit - and I prefer a quieter environment for massage. But the massage quality was excellent and the therapists (I had Ramsey both times - husband had Santoss and ... I forgot the other name) were so nice and personable. They spoke better English too than most people in Thamel! Massages when we went were 1500 rps/60 min and 2100 rps/90 min - so it equates to about $18 USD.

The best massage ever. I visited the Kathmandu clinic when returning from my 10 day trek in Annapurna. I got a massage from Ramji and it was just perfect. He has healing hands and always find the spots which need to be worked out. The clinic is very clean and all the staff id professional and friendly. I highly recommend you to stop there after your trek!I was so happy with the 1st massage that I returned for another relaxing one 2 days later just before heading to the airport!
Just what the doctor ordered. Got a sports massage. This guy hit all my pressure points. One of the best massages I have had and I've had quiet a few in Thailand. Well worth a visit

Look for them. You really need to look for the signs as they are easily missed. We visited Seeing Hands in Pokhara and enjoyed the experience so we thought we'd support the Kathmandu branch. I do say enjoyed with tongue in cheek as they find all the knots and problem areas and work them. No pain, no gain. They really are very good at what they do and the cost is well worth it.
