Best massage I have ever had!!. Worked all the muscles. Very nice strong massage which I like. Listened to what I needed and wanted. Superb!!
Best massage in Kathmandu. If you want a correct massage that addresses your issues and not a holiday rub than this is the place. Its also for a good cause so it's rude not to go.

Nice experience. Although our taxi driver took a while to find the place we, my wife and I experienced a very professional and well done massage. The massage therapists continually inquired of us on how to proceed with varying degrees of pressure. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Recommend Highly!

Great Swedish Massage in Kathmandu. After trying out the blind massage branch in Pokhara, I also gave the Kathmandu version a try. There is basically the same to say about both places: The different people that gave the massages were all very well trained and highly professional in giving a wonderful western-style massage. It was good fun to support such a great project that gives work to blind people. The people that treated me there were extremely nice and spoke good english - some of them were a little too talkative to really relax - but of course I would probably be same if I couldn't see the world and people around me.I would highly recommend this place for a general well-being massage if you have no acute pains which you want to have treated. For the latter I would rather go to places like Sotai in Kathmandu and Patan where the staff is perfectly trained in curing whatever discomforts you might bring to them.Many of the other "specialised" massage places around Thamel are not as professional as they might look like. Many are even brothels rather than massage parlours. A "foot reflexology" in many cases is often not at all related to the "reflex" points but rather a general lower leg massage. Many of the "ayurvedic massage" places are also not upto any standard one might expect. If you want a surely great treatment - in western style though - stick to blind massage. A safe bet! I hope they introduce some Asian or alternative massage techniques there some day!

Absolutely Amazing!. Seeing Hands clinic is a brilliant clinic in Thamel, run by blind masseurs. The guys there were friendly, welcoming and gave me and my friends brilliant massages. We felt really comfortable and they were very attentive. I can't recommend coming to this place enough. And it is non-profit. It was the perfect massage after completing the Everest Base Camp trek too.

Not like the other Massage places!. Sadly katmandu has a number of dubious massage places around and even the non dubious are probably not trained. nepal has no real tradition of massage so don't be fooled by any supposed traditional aspects. Seeing hands is new to katmandu but has been established in Pokhara for many years and this is simply an offshoot. Theres usually a westerner to oversee the work as its a charity and the blind practitioners are trained by them. Most seem to be chiropracters etc. Having had a few back problems in my time I was hopeful that they could sort out mine, which they did. Its not what they're there for (its supposed to simply be massage after all) but the level of expertise by these guys (and girls) is impressive. So if you've done your back in on a trek or simply want a relaxing massage then come here, its a great scheme and reasonable prices.

Wonderful in every way. I've just had a truly exceptional massage at Seeing Hands. Seriously... go to these guys. Not only will you be supporting a truly wonderful endeavor, but you also will have a top quality professional massage. Seeing Hands should really be supported - they deserve it.

Great massage and great service. I visited Seeing Hands twice during my 2 month stay in Kathmandu. The two therapists that I saw (Laxmi and Santosh) had slightly different techniques, but both gave very professional massages, with just the right amount of pressure etc. Perfect for post-trekking or just to relax when the craziness of Kathmandu is getting a bit much for you. During June and July they were not too busy so it was easy to book an appointment. Well worth the extra rupees compared to some of the other massage places around.

wonderful message in kathmandu. At the end of our trip, we wanted to go to massage to make our body relax because we depart from Nepal. there are 100s of massage center in thamel but one of our guides took us to Seeing Hands Clinic........ wow ...... it was like....... no words.I booked for 60 minutes massage but at the end I went for 2 hours....... note they have their clinic in Pokahra as well.
Warm and welcoming. Relaxing and pleasant experience, made unique by the concept. Bit of a fiddle to locate, but so are most things in Thamel.

Excellent massage for a great cause. I had an excellent massage from Lakshmi. She was very kind and had a gentle demeanour but gave a very hard and thorough all over massage. All the masseuses seem to be very well trained and will go as hard or soft as you want. Aside from that, I think what this NGO is doing is excellent in creating a sustainable living for those who work there. Highly recommended!

WOW!. I am very nervous about getting my body out to people, so this was the only time I was gonna get a massage. And I am very glad i did the lady was brilliant at her job!!!My bf also all loved it! we are both really pleased we went :)

BEST MASSAGE EVER!. This is worth every cent!! The clinic is clean and the staff are so friendly. I had a massage off a young guy and as I am not used to getting a massage of a male, i wondered how I would feel about it, but this guy was so amazing and really had a gift of making you feel comfortable and giving a great massage. This was my highlight of kathmandu

very noisy, phone was going off all the time. I went to the one in Thamel, it was not as relaxing as expected as the room was right next to the road and a car was unloading bottles right outside the window. Also the phone of the massagist was going off all the time. It was on silence but I could still hear it, and one time even feel it as it was in her pocket and leaning on my body!

Excellent Massage and good support. I feel more supporting to blind people than using the massage services but i do not means that i did not get good services. It was excellent and porfesional massage. Thank you guys and keep it up!

Great Experience. I had a massage done here, as mentioned by other reviewers the masseuse is a blind person but that actually makes them better at what they do.I took the 60 Minutes massage and it was amazing , I was actually tipsy after it. Loved it and totally reccomend it

Sorry, but worst massage ever. I was really looking forward to my massage here based on the reviews I'd read. Unfortunately, this was the worst massage I have ever had. I could tell as soon as the girl put her hands on me that she had no idea what she was doing and half the time I felt like she was trying to massage my bones. I feel bad about writing a negative review, but I guess the point of tripadvisor is that you're honest, and I don't want others going with high expectations like I did. To be fair, when I left, I noticed in the review book some really great comments, but next to the girl's name that I had, someone else had also written a negative review. I'm guessing I just got the wrong masseur!

best message. the only other message I ever had was in a 400 year old bath house in Istanbul. Therefore, I do not qualify as an expert but if feeling good is a good criteria, the Seeing Hands Clinic was terrific

Excellent. I became interested in Seeing hands after a friend told me about the history behind it being set up by a couple from London to help blind people in Nepal, who had trouble finding jobs, by training them in massage. I booked a 2 hour massage after I came back from trek and I would highly recommend others do to so too, it was well worth it. They had a professional massage table, the rooms were spacious and they had a seperate shower/bathroom for customers to use.I had a female masseur who although was tiny was very stronge and was easily able to work on all of my aches and pains. I would advise to book in advance as they are popular and book up very quickly.
Very, very good massage. Honestly, it is first-class! Just go there and feel for yourself. I and all the other reviewers are not lying here.

Very Good massage at an Excellent price!. My hotel charged $125 for a one hour massage. After finding this on trip advisor, my wife and I paid a visit. The facilities were very clean and the staff was pleasant. The massage was very good, but not phenomenal. The price is so low that it was almost enough to rate this as excellent. I would definetly visit again. We received two massages with tips included for $30.

Believe it!!!. This one is worth the visit. My hit list looks like this: EBC, Pokhara, Last resort, and Seeing Hands Clinic. Well worth the visit. Never had a massage by a man, but Chilan ?spl was professional. He asked where to focus, then began the beat down and torture session. He dug into some old war injuries from high school football, motorcycle crashes, and some random ones I didn't know about. Afterwards I felt mobility in my shoulders and neck that was missing for years. When I hit it big he's got a spot in my entourage!

AMAZING!!!. After reading so many reviews, my girlfriend and I decided to give Seeing Hands a shot... let me tell you, this was one of the best massages I have received. The therapists and staff are all exceptional and friendly, and they know what theyre doing. They gave us the story as to how the clinic opened, and it was quite interesting. During the massage, they actually pay attention to every last detail, and its amazing how well trained they are. Even though the therapists can't see, as they were doing the massage, they could feel exactly where I had knots in my back, and they would focus on those areas.I would HIGHLY suggest for anyone who visits KTM to pass by....

Excellent massage. My mom and I went to the seeing hands clinic in Thamel (just opposite the Gaia cafe), and it was really great. It was so good that we immediately booked another 90 min appointment for 3 days later (when coming back from our trekking). Both my mom and I had a very positive experience, and both the women and the man massaging us did an amazing job, just finding the right spots and working on them.Very clean and comfortable environment as well.NB: prices just went up, but 90 min massage for 24 dollars is still very very cheap.

Don't miss it. The massage done by blind people and it's very special. They are professional, the place to… neat and clean and the massage itself is very good. And also you have the chance to support the blind community helping them to make a living trough a healing practice.

more than 'seeing hands'. This is a special place to go and have a massage. I went for one before my trek and booked another for when I was back. It is a massage clinic. . . clean and professional. I felt 'new born' after this long non rushed massage that was great value for money. They provide a great service in clean premises. It seems as if there are quite a few massage parlours around which should not be compared with this clinic.
Highly recommended. A great massage in clean surroundings. I actually had a thigh muscle problem and I must say after a few visits the problem subsided. A very nice couple run the place.
Amazing. Definately the best massage I have ever had . a must do
Great massage. Easy to find. good service and value. went twice it was so good. highly recommended
Best massage ever. We had the best experience. Very good sports massage. We had an hour massage before trekking and one after:) Also very reasonable price.

Best Massage Ever!. After a long plane flight half way around the world and then a week of treking, the Seeing Hands Clinic delivered the best massage we have ever had! Was really amazing! Be careful of the other massage places in Thamel, they can be VERY dodge! This was a legitimate massage place that will definitely sort out sore and tired muscles!

Excellent post-trek massage. We visited Seeing Hands after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and we weren't disappointed. From the moment we arrived the staff were friendly and professional. The facilities were clean and modern and the massages were great value for money. I had the 'relaxation massage' and my partner had the 'sports massage' - both of which can be highly recommended. All in all, a really great experience!

Therapeutic Massage. I haven't actually been to the clinic itself but I did receive a 10 minute sample by one of Seeing Hands massage therapists at their stall during the Barbar Mahal Revisited Night Bazaar. I'll be honest, the massage was quite painful but only because they are well-trained and know what they are doing. This isn't for someone who's looking for a simple relaxation massage during which they will fall asleep. If you are coming back from a trek or generally feel tight from your travels, the therapists at Seeing Hands will address every knot and ache you might have. I knew I was in desperate need of a tune up of the neck and back and in only 10 minutes, though quite painful, I walked away feeling looser, more relaxed and generally pain-free. I will be booking a full massage shortly to get the rest of the kinks worked out! Lastly, I'd like to mention that Seeing Hands is a wonderful organization that is doing a lot for the blind community in Nepal. The organization really is turning what many here believe to be a "disability" into a real gift.

Best massage ever!. I totally agree with all previous reviews and positive comments. I've visited Seeing Hands Clinic on my last day in Kathmandu and I honestly regret that I didn't go there earlier. Clinic was actually located 3 min from my hotel (Holy Himalaya Hotel).I have registered my visit in the morning and had this amazing massage the same evening after busy day. I've chosen 1h relaxing massage and that was absolutely enough - I wouldn't probably survive sporting or extreme massage. Everything was clean and fresh (really clean even up to European and American standards!) and price for such massage is so low - this is 'must do' when in Kathmandu. I was amazed how professional, calm and strong my massager was - I didn't know that I have so many points on my body which could provide so much pain, but he controlled that and not even once I had to say to stop - he knew exactly how strong he should massage me - absolutely stunning. Next time in Kathmandu I will be booking this massage probably for every single day; it is worth it and helps them as well to have decent job and salary. 5+ as a recommendation.

Wonderful Experience. My husband and i visited Seeing hands on the last day of our trip to Kathmandu. It was a wonderful experience. Their massage eased away the aches and pain of all the climbing and walking we did on our trip. A "must visit" if you enjoy a good massage and the best part is that a part of the charges goes towards charity!! Felt good ;-)
As good as they say.. Best massage you'll ever get for £10. Friendly and accommadating.

Extraordinary experience with highly trained and talented practitioners. During my time in Nepal during October/November 2011, I visited Chiran at the Seeing Hands clinic 3 times - it was that good. In particular, the treatment I received before and after a mountaineering trip in the Everest region was the best remedial treatment I have ever received. After many treatments by many massage and related therapists over the last 15 years, these treatments were extraordinary. As I write this back in Melbourne, I would love to be transported back for a treatment! Whether you are about to climb mountains or battling the Kathmandu traffic, I highly recommend visiting the Seeing Hands Clinic in either Kathmandu or Pokhara - you won't be disappointed.

Relaxing massage and friendly professional servive. We had a massage here in November after trekking. The whole experience was enjoyable, with friendly and professional blind massage staff. It's a very worthwhile charity to support, and we definitely recommend that you give them a go.
Best massage I've ever had. These guys were amazing, very worldly, friendly and professional!
good job. glad to visit this place before leave kathmandu, had an good time here.
Needs a little cleaning. Both mass were fined but it seems the place is a little dirt, and the towels must be changed!!!.

Great massage for a great cause. A great massage by the blind masseurs, they can feel the knots and trigger points that others miss. This massage place is set up by a UK charity to provide blind Nepalis with a way of life so you know your sore Trekkers legs aren't the only thing benefiting from the massage.

Brilliant place. Great massage, perfect thing to do after a trek. Much prefer giving our money to these people. I cant imagine theres any other opportunities for young blind men & women in Nepal. I'll definitely go back there after my next trek.

wow! The best massage I ever had...for only $15!!!. This place is the hidden gem of Kathmandu. The British couple that have set us this massage clinic ought to be congratulated! All the massage therapists are blind and professionally trained. I have had many professional remedial and sports massages in Australia but none come close to the professionalism of this place! The staff are extremely polite, outstandingly versed in English and have the hands of gods!...all for Rs.1200/hr!!! If you're looking for an amazing pre- or post-trek massage, go here. But know this, it's not a dodgy "massage" parlour where you will get propositioned for sex - it is strictly professional and will provide possibly the best massage you will ever have!Its a bit tricky to find but head down the alley RIGHT TO THE END and its in the nice looking building/house on your right. I didn't even book, just walked in. I highly recommend this place, plus your money is going to train more blind Nepali massage therapists - a great cause indeed!
Excellent after a walk in the mountains. Very well trained people who provided an excellent service. The massage was great.

Great massage and wonderful staff. My boyfriend and I tried the seeing hands massage, and it was a great experience.The staff was very friendly, and they spoke English at a higher level than we have heard any where else in Nepal. They asked us several times if we liked the pressure, if we feld comfortable etc. We had a therapist each and enjoyed our massages in a very clean and nice room. Highly recommendable for couples sinces you can chat away during the massage.We Got 90 minutes and that was not a second too much.
Relaxing. Excellent massage. Reasonable price. Professional service.

A+. Seeing Hands is a God sent! I had the 60min relaxation massage and will definitely be heading back for another! The whole experience was flawless: the office and massage room are extremely clean and comfortable and the staff are very knowledgable (we even heard them discussing different anatomy units throughout the massage!), 100% professional and very friendly. I thought it was really good value for money as well (12,000rps for 60mins), and knowing that their profits go to such a great cause we ended up making a donation as well (only US$50 covers the scholarship to train a new masseuse).Definitely recommend!

The best massage in the world. I went there in April 2011 and I had a massage with Laxmi (I hope that's the way it is spelled). She was extremely professional, I just can not forget those massages, I went there everyday during my stay in Nepal.Things about the place: Very clean, very welcoming! It's the perfect solution for those who goes there for trekking. Go to have a massage there after.It's a couple that runs the business and they are so friendly.I would recommend Seeing Hands as the best part of Nepal.
Great massage. Blind couple giving a massage. Great value for money - take their time and apply great strength! Definitely recommned.

interesting experience. I went to the seeing hands clinic in Pokhara and Kathmandu. Both massage were good and strong. I really had the feeling that they know what they were doing. Although it was really tough and they found my week spots. Autsch! :) The clinic is basic and clean. It lays in a quiet street close to the restaurant Gaia. People are nice.

Excellent Massage. My masseur was named Shiran and he was such a nice man. His wife was called laxmi and she was nice, too. The whole place was clean and well-managed, with a friendly and helpful receptionist. Needless to say, the massage was one of the best. Very professional. It was obvious that they have been well-trained. Highly recommended and an incredibly important project for the blind people of Nepal. Top marks.

Great Massage. I get massages all over the world, and this one was great. Deep tissue massage for 1,200 Rupees for an hour (approx USD $16). A bit more than I pay for in other developing countries, but Chiran is a great masseur and it is a bargain for the amount you pay.

Best Massage I have ever had in Nepal!. I am visiting in Nepal twice a year and get massages every time. I heard about 'Seeing Hands' had opened a clinic in Kathmandu so thought to check them out. Wow! Not only was it an excellent quality of deep tissue massage, the whole atmosphere was very welcoming, clean and safe. By far 150% better than the average massage clinic in Kathmandu! Plus the anatomical knowledge of the practitioner was above average. Highly recommend. Especially for solo women, who might have reservations of getting a massage, they have women & male practitioners, but all are 'safe' in my experience so far. I will be back! thanks guys ...

High Quality Massage in Kathmandu. My wife and I have been going to the same masseuse in Sydney for the past 12 years, and whilst travelling it is very difficult to find one of a similar standard. However this was not the case with Chiran at Seeing Hands Massage where we received a great deep tissue sports massage, both before and after our trek in the Himalayas.I would highly recommend the massage to anyone going to Kathmandu, plus it is good to know that you are helping to support such a worthy organisation.

Don't miss the chance to get a massage here!. My friend and I went to get a massage here 3 times during a 4 day stay. Enough said. We were originally attracted by the idea that this was a charity clinic, but became repeat clients because of the exceptional skills of the therapists. I get regular massages back home in Canada, and my massages here were among the best I've ever received. The massage therapist manged to find and get out knots in an extremely skillful manner. I was amazed by how good I felt after the massage. I highly recommend this clinic. You will not be disappointed.

day at the spa. They give fantastic massages. Also you can do an day at the spa for an excellent price! Will it be exactly like a spa day in America, no but it is totally worth it after a long trek in the mountains! The massages are fantastic! The facial is interesting, so go ahead be adventurous, it doesn't hurt. The mani/pedi is fantastic! 7 hours of pampering = one amazing experience!

One of my best messages. The host was lovely and the massage was so professional! The prices similar to any other place but the service and the treatment really changes the balance! Value for money- yes yes yes. Highly reccomend going there!

Ofuro. I was surprised seeing such a good spa in thamel is a family oriented spa it was really good getting experience in real spa. I usually go to the spa in lajimpat but this is the best spa in Nepal I was amazed.i took my family in every weekends to this spa the only thing that I didn't like is noisy when I went in that spa there were a group and they started arguing each other it makes me little difficult to relax but this is the best spa in thamel.

2 Different Experiences. I had 2 different experiences in this spa: the first was so terrific that I scheduled a repeat massage with the same masseuse 2 days later. Unfortunately, the 2nd time, the spa was packed, which caused problems with scheduling, and a rushed, less-than-great atmosphere.The pros: the spa is very well equipped and professional - it's not a "joint." They have a locker room, showers, sauna and steam room, and the massage rooms are OK. (no music or candles, though, which is a pity). They give you slippers and towels, and there's a waiting area.I had a swedish massage both times.First time was a dream! She really knew what she was doing, and it was as good as any massage I've had anywhere in the world.When I returned 2 days later -- after having scheduled for a specific hour and a specific person - the waiting area was full. My partner and I were then rushed to a room together, and the 2 masseuses chatted between themselves. I asked them to observe the quiet.The shower/locker room was very crowded.Lesson learned: GO EARLY IN THE DAY. The evening becomes too rushed, and affects the experience. When it's good, it's great.

Best massage ever!!!!. After trying so many massage places around Kathmandu,we found this one in Thamel.This is the best spa for massage. I had the best massage ever!!! We tried Thailand many times,but this place was the best. If you want to have the best massage ask for Shanta or Srijana.

The best Nepali Thai massage. I love Thai massage and had tried a lot all over the world including Thailand of course. This one at Kathmandu was out of this world. I didn't know I could be twisted and bent in that many ways. At one point I was fully elevated from the bed with him under me. Best message ever after a long trek

make sure how long they massage.. I payed for 60 minutes,but a stuff massaged me for 50 minutes.and a clock in the room was 10 minutes faster than exactly.so it made me feel they tried to cut 10 minutes.６０分のマッサージを注文しましたが実際は５０分でした。部屋の中にあった時計は実際と１０分進んでおり、わざとカットされたようにも感じます。マッサージも背中はうまくできたいる方でしたが、ヘッドマッサージはさっぱりでした。もう少し払ってでも、ガイドブックに載っているようなマッサージ店に行く事をおすすめします。

Showers are hot, rooms have air conditioning, lockers, no power cuts.. the whole experience was just great, and I am quite surprised to be the very first one to review this place on tripadvisor, though they have a fb page with pictures and stuff.. https://www.facebook.com/pages/Real-Therapy-Beauty-Point/309665892519494

Amazing massage and Sirodhara treament. I cannot urge you enough to make time to visit Kinjjala Spa. I have had many massages in my time, however, this was the best. I finished my massage with a Sirodhara treatment - I think I just floated out at the end - highly recommend.
what a awesome place in Thamel. ABC 트레킹 후 찾은 곳!타멜 거리에서 마사지샵을 몇 군데 알아봤었는데 제일 깨끗합니다. 사장님이 아주 좋고 트레킹 후 모든 피로가 사라집니다. 최고!I visited after ABC trekking very kind people and owner. all of my fatigue gone!!!

Wow!. There are many spas in Thamel alone and I had visited one before walking into Kinjjala. To be honest the only reason I came here was because a friend gave me a 20% off services card, but little did I know I would be one lucky girl to have received it.As soon as I entered Kinjalla I was warmly greeted with a "Namaste" said in unison, hands to heart, by all the present staff. Invited to take a seat, the manager handed me a menu with a large variety of services at surprisingly low prices.After a bit of questioning and honest suggestions/answers from the kind, attentive manager, I was guided through a sliding door where I was met with nothing less than a clean, well maintained, spa. I was truly impressed with the quality of my surroundings.In the first room I received a full leg and underarm waxing where the well trained ladies did their best to remove EVERY hair. It was a lengthy procedure, but nonetheless I was pleased with the finished product.Next, I was taken to a smaller private room for my 60 minute Swedish massage and all I can say is WOW. After given the choice of a male or female masseuse, (female of course), I received the woman who worked on my waxing so I was already comfortable with her presence and touch. I can't speak for all of the workers, but if any of them produce a massage like she does then you can't go wrong! I was so relaxed and her techniques were extremely effective in reaching what felt like every muscle in my body!Lastly, I was pampered like a princess during my duo mani-pedi with exfoliation, lotions, and more massage accompanied, of course, with a hot cup of tea offered by the manager who occasionally checked on me to make sure all was well.To top it all off, upon the completion of my services I was kindly awarded with yet another 25% discount for my next visit AND a complimentary foot massage! Again, the total price was very inexpensive for all the work I received. During my stay I was comfortable and well looked after. Needless to say I left a happy, satisfied customer and will definitely be returning.The only down side I would say was the length of time my beauty services took. If you come to this spa make sure you have the time and be ready to be treated like a queen (or king!).

Heaven. I cannot say enough good things about Mandala Studio Yoga and Spa. I had such a wonderful experience there between the yoga class I took and the full spa day package I did. First, the yoga classes are all very nice, with good teachers who each bring their uniqueness to the class. I appreciated that the teachers were so friendly. They offer many different types of yoga classes, so whether you're into yin, Ashtanga, or vinyasa, there is a class here for you.Now...the full day spa package. You must do it if you have time and are looking to treat yourself. At a great price - you get multiple spa treatments, breakfast and lunch, as well as a morning yoga class, and meditation at the end of the day. Also, the massage therapists are so caring and thoughtful. They really take care of you and make sure that you are comfortable and relaxed. It was a perfect way to end my month of travel in the beautiful country of Nepal.Also, the owners are super friendly and welcoming. It's inspiring to know how much the founder has invested into the study of yoga and sharing it with others, as well (you can find his bio on their website).Overall, this was a wonderful experience. Thank you to Mandala Studio for a lovely time!

Great yoga and spa. My partner and i are staying 2.5 monts in nepal and chose to take 10 yoga classes for $60 each. We are complète beginners. The classes are great for all levels. It'located in the only pedestrian street of Thamel is a huge advantage for the. constant horning. finally, We got a free massage on top with we did yesterday after 2 weeks of trekking. Very relaxing. Yoga tearcher certificate. I have been teaching yoga in Sooriya yoga, Laximpat for a while. I wanted to upgrade my teaching skills. I found Kritis yoga studio during my visit to thamel.
